import java.math.BigInteger;
import java.util.Scanner;

class TPATHS {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner sc=new Scanner(System.in);
        int t;
        BigInteger x;
        t=sc.nextInt();
            BigInteger count[][]=new BigInteger[1100][1100];
    for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++)
    {
    count[i][0]=BigInteger.valueOf(1);
    }
    for (int j = 0; j < 1000; j++)
        count[0][j] = BigInteger.valueOf(1); 
    for (int i = 1; i < 1000; i++)
    {
        for (int j = 1; j < 1000; j++)
            count[i][j] = count[i-1][j].add(count[i][j-1]);
 
    }
    while(t>0)
        {x=sc.nextBigInteger();
    int k=0; 
        for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++)
    {
        for (int j = 0; j < 1000; j++)
        {
            if(x.equals(count[i][j])) k++;
        }
    }
           if(k!=0) System.out.println(k);
           else System.out.println("The Grid is Too Big!");
            for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++)
    {
        for (int j = 0; j < 1000; j++)
        {
            if(x.equals(count[i][j])) System.out.println((i+1)+" "+(j+1));
        }
    }
            
            t--;
        }
    }
    
}
